title.narrative: Improving Food, Nutrition and Livelihoods Security in Luri and Lado Counties Jubek State

description.narrative: This is a 1year project aimed at Improving Food, Nutrition and Livelihoods Security of women, men, girls and boys including People Living with HIV and AIDs (PLWHA) and People Living with Disability (PLWD) in Luri and Lado Counties Jubek State. The project which will be implemented by Caritas Catholic Archdiocese of Juba will contribute to Sustainable Development Goals 2 (end hunger and ensure access by all people in project locations, in particular the poor and people in vulnerable situations, including infants, to safe, nutritious and sufficient food all year round and promote sustainable agriculture). This project will ensure sustainable food production systems and implement resilient agricultural practices that increase productivity and production, that help maintain ecosystems, that strengthen capacity for adaptation to climate change, extreme weather, drought, flooding and other disasters and that progressively improve land and soil quality. The project will also have components of peace building and conflict resolution integrated to mitigate existing conflict between the cattle keepers and farmers. It will also provide start up capital for youth to create jobs and will restock chickens for most vulnerable members of the community. According to FEWSNET there will be an estimated 6.96 million people (61% of the population) are likely to face food security Crisis with the majority of people being in IPC Phase 3 and Phase 4. The food insecurity situation is likely to worsen, in the period May-July 2019 to July August 2019 as shown in Map 1 : Current Food Security Outcomes June 2019. Despite the decline in conflict many households have lost key livelihood assets and strategies to cope with food insecurity as a result of the persistent conflict. The loss of key assets and livelihood options will continue to drive high levels of acute food insecurity. This is historically the highest number of people in South Sudan ever to face Crisis (IPC Phase 3) acute food insecurity or worse.
